workflow.name: Generate personalized cold email openers with website scraping using Claude & GPT-4
workflow.description:
**This template enriches a lead list by analyzing each contact‚Äôs company website and auto-generating a single personalized cold-email opener. Drop a spreadsheet into a Google Drive folder ‚Üí the workflow parses rows, fetches website content via Jina AI, uses OpenAI to check if the site contains valid business info, then calls Anthropic to craft a one-liner. It writes both the website summary and personalized opener back to Google Sheets, and finally sends you a Telegram confirmation with the file link.**

## What it does
Turns a CSV/Google Sheet of leads into tailored cold-email openers. For each lead, the workflow fetches the company website, writes a 300-word business summary, then crafts a one-sentence, emotionally engaging opening line. Results are written back to the same Sheet, and you get a Telegram ping when processing finishes.

## How it works (high-level)
	1.	Trigger: Watches a Google Drive folder. When a new Sheet is added, the flow starts.
	2.	Parse: Reads rows (expects columns like First Name, Last Name, Email, domain).
	3.	Enrich: An AI Agent calls Jina ‚Äúr.jina.ai/{url}‚Äù to fetch page markdown, then produces a structured website summary.
	4.	Validate: An OpenAI step checks if the fetched content is a real business page (hasWebsite: true/false).
	5.	Personalize:
	‚Ä¢	If true ‚Üí Anthropic crafts a bespoke opener using the summary.
	‚Ä¢	If false ‚Üí Fallback prompt creates a strong opener using domain + universal lead-gen pains.
	6.	Update: Writes websiteSummary and personalization back to the Sheet (matching on domain).
	7.	Notify: Sends a Telegram message with the file name + link when done.

## What you need
	‚Ä¢	Google Drive (folder to watch)
	‚Ä¢	Google Sheets (the uploaded Sheet to enrich)
	‚Ä¢	Jina HTTP header auth (for the markdown fetch tool)
	‚Ä¢	OpenAI (JSON check for website validity)
	‚Ä¢	Anthropic (Claude Sonnet 4 for copy quality)
	‚Ä¢	Telegram Bot (to receive completion alerts)

## Inputs & expected schema
	‚Ä¢	A Google Sheet with at least: First Name, Last Name, Email, domain
	‚Ä¢	Optional columns are preserved; rows are processed in batches.

## Outputs
	‚Ä¢	New/updated columns per row:
	‚Ä¢	websiteSummary ‚Äî concise, structured business overview
	‚Ä¢	personalization ‚Äî a single, high-impact opening sentence
	‚Ä¢	Telegram confirmation with file name and link.

## Customization tips
	‚Ä¢	Tweak the system prompts for tone or length.
	‚Ä¢	Add scoring (e.g., ICP fit) before personalization.
	‚Ä¢	Expand validation (e.g., handle multi-page sites or language detection).
	‚Ä¢	Swap/parallel LLMs to balance quality, cost, and speed.

## Nodes & key logic
	‚Ä¢	Google Drive Trigger ‚Üí Google Drive (Download) ‚Üí Spreadsheet File (parse) ‚Üí Split in Batches
	‚Ä¢	LangChain Agent with: HTTP Tool (Jina) + Think
	‚Ä¢	OpenAI (JSON validator) ‚Üí If (website present?)
	‚Ä¢	Anthropic Chat (with + without website branches)
	‚Ä¢	Edit Fields (Set) ‚Üí Google Sheets (Update) ‚Üí Telegram

## Great for
Sales teams, SDRs, and founders who want fast, high-quality personalization at scale without manual research.

## **Need help customizing?**
Contact me for consulting and support: [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mariela-ceo-founder/)

parameters.content: ## Personalization based on the website summary

parameters.text:
=Please analyze the website at {{ $json.domain }} and create a structured business summary according to the template. Use the "Fetch Markdown via Jina AI" tool to get the website content.
{{ $json.chatInput }}

options.systemMessage:
=You are a business analyst who specializes in extracting valuable information from company websites. 
Your task is to create a concise but comprehensive summary of the company based on their website content.

Follow this template:
1. Company Overview: Brief description of what the company does
2. Products/Services: Main offerings
3. Target Market: Who they serve
4. Unique Selling Points: What makes them different
5. Company Size/Scale: Any indicators of company size
6. Potential Pain Points: Business challenges they might be facing

Keep your response under 300 words. Focus on factual information in the website content.

parameters.toolDescription: Fetch Webpage Markdown via Jina AI. This is useful for getting details of a webpage found from the Google Search tools

values.name: url
values.description: This is the url to be accessed via Jina to extract the pages markdown

parameters.text:
=Create ONE personalized, emotional opening sentence for a cold email to {{ $('Loop Over Items1').item.json['First Name'] }} {{ $('Loop Over Items1').item.json['Last Name'] }} that will compel them to read further. Focus on our Lead Generation Sales System that saves time.
Output only the sentence, nothing else.

options.systemMessage:
You are a sales development expert crafting personalized cold email opening lines without website data.

IMPORTANT: This prompt is ONLY for cases where website data is missing or couldn't be scraped.

Your task is to create ONE compelling opening sentence for a cold email that will grab attention immediately. Since we don't have website data, focus on:

1. Using the company name and domain to make relevant industry assumptions
2. Addressing a universal pain point related to lead generation that resonates with their likely business challenges
3. Creating curiosity about our Lead Generation Sales System
4. Mentioning a specific benefit (saving time, reducing costs, increasing conversion rates)
5. Making it conversational and emotionally engaging (15-25 words maximum)

OUR PRODUCT: We offer a Lead Generation Sales System that automates prospect identification, qualification, and outreach sequences. Key benefits include:
- 60% reduction in time spent on manual prospecting
- 40% lower customer acquisition costs
- 3x higher quality leads through AI-powered targeting
- Elimination of repetitive sales tasks

TONE GUIDELINES:
- Confident but not aggressive
- Curious rather than presumptive
- Focused on their potential gains, not their current problems
- Conversational, as if from one professional to another

EXAMPLES OF EXCELLENT OPENERS:
- "What if your sales team at [Company] could focus exclusively on closing while an automated system handles all prospecting, [First Name]?"
- "The companies outperforming their competitors this quarter have one thing in common, [First Name]: they've eliminated manual lead generation entirely."
- "Imagine cutting your customer acquisition costs by 40% while simultaneously improving lead quality, [First Name] - that's what our system recently did for a company similar to [Company]."
- "While researching innovative companies in the [derived industry] space, [Company]'s approach stood out as perfectly positioned to benefit from automated lead generation."

Remember: ONE sentence only. Make it compelling enough that they WANT to read the next line of the email.

You are a sales development expert who specializes in creating highly personalized, engaging cold email opening lines.

Your task is to craft ONE compelling sentence that will make the recipient want to read the entire email. This opening line must:

1. Be personalized based on the company's specific information
2. Create an emotional connection immediately
3. Be conversational and natural-sounding (not formulaic)
4. Demonstrate genuine understanding of their business or challenges
5. Be 15-25 words maximum
6. Include a subtle hint of value without being salesy

IF THE WEBSITE ENRICHMENT DATA IS MISSING OR CONTAINS AN ERROR:
Create a compelling opening line focused on our Lead Generation Sales System that:
- References saving time and money on lead generation
- Uses the recipient's name and company domain for basic personalization
- Suggests a pain point common in their industry based on their domain
- Maintains the emotional, conversational tone

Our product is a Lead Generation Sales System that automates prospecting, qualification, and outreach, saving companies significant time and resources while improving conversion rates.

DO NOT:
- Use generic phrases like "I noticed your company" or "I was browsing your website"
- Sound like an obvious template
- Include multiple sentences or run-on sentences
- Use excessive flattery
- Make claims you can't support

Examples of good openers:
- "Your approach to sustainable manufacturing at [Company] would make a perfect case study for our upcoming industry report."
- "The innovative patient engagement system you've built at [Company] addresses the exact healthcare communication gaps our platform was designed to solve."
- "Your team's commitment to data-driven marketing decisions aligns perfectly with the analytics framework we've developed for agencies like yours."

Examples for when website data is missing (for our Lead Generation Sales System):
- "What if your team at [Company] could reclaim 15 hours weekly from manual lead generation, [First Name]?"
- "Imagine cutting your customer acquisition costs by 40% while your sales team focuses solely on closing, [First Name]."
- "The difference between struggling and thriving businesses often comes down to lead quality, something we've helped companies like [Company] transform."

parameters.content: ## Determines if we have scraped the website successfully

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
